documentation: # Freshdesk This guide walks you through setting up the Freshdesk integration within Boltic. ## Prerequisites To set up the Freshdesk integration, you'll need: - A Freshdesk account - The Freshdesk domain name - The Freshdesk API Key ## Setting Up the Freshdesk Integration in Boltic 1. **Log In** - Log into your Freshdesk account. 2. **Obtain API Key** - In the upper-right corner, click on your profile picture and select **Profile Settings**. - In the right sidebar, click the **View API key** button. - Copy the API key value shown and store it in a safe place. 3. **Log into Boltic** - Log into your Boltic account or navigate to the Boltic Open Source dashboard. 4. **Navigate to Integrations** - Click on `Sources` and then click on `+ Add New source`. 5. **Select Source Type** - On the Set up the source page, search for `Freshdesk` from the search bar and select it. 6. **Configure Integration** - **Name:** Enter a name for the Freshdesk integration. - **Domain:** Enter your Freshdesk domain name. For example, if your Freshdesk URL is `https://abc.freshdesk.com`, enter `abc`. - **API Key:** Paste the API key copied from the Freshdesk Profile Settings. 7. **Details (Optional)** - **Tags:** Add any tags for categorization. - **Description:** Provide a brief description of the integration. 8. **Test and Save Integration** - Click `Test Connection` to ensure the provided details are correct and the connection is successful. - Once the connection test is successful, click `Set up source` to complete the configuration. ## Setting Up Freshdesk Webhooks Freshdesk uses webhooks to trigger a scenario when an event occurs. To set up a webhook: 1. Add a Freshdesk instant module to your scenario and click **Create a webhook**. 2. **Webhook Name:** Enter a name for the webhook (optional). 3. **Connection:** Select the corresponding connection for the webhook. 4. Click **Save** and then **Copy address to clipboard**. 5. Log in to your Freshdesk account using Freshdesk Login. 6. Follow the directions as outlined in the Freshdesk Using Webhooks in Automation documentation. Freshdesk will now send data to Boltic through the webhook when the selected event occurs. ## Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) 1. **How do I find my Freshdesk API Key?** - Navigate to your Freshdesk account settings and look for the Profile Settings tab to find your API Key. Follow the instructions provided earlier in this guide. 2. **What should I do if my connection fails?** - Ensure your API Key is correct. - Verify the domain name and ensure there are no typos. - Check your network connection and firewall settings. 3. **How often is the data synced?** - The data sync frequency is determined by the settings configured during setup. You can customize the sync frequency as needed. 4. **Can I customize the data being synced?** - Yes, you can customize the data being synced by adjusting the settings during the setup process. ## Support If you need further assistance, please contact Boltic support or visit our Support Documentation.
